title: In an exam, 14% students fail and 559 students passed. What is the number of students who fail? - Quora

response.answer_text: If 559 pass and 14 percent fail. 14 percent must equal 91 as 1 percent-would equal 6.5 559 divided by 86 = 6.5 and 14 multiplied by 6.5 = 91. (6.5 equalling 1 %

14% — Failed . 559 Students — Passed. 100%-14%=86%of Students Passed which is 559 Students. Let us assume that total number of students are X. 86% of X=559. X= (559*100)/86=650. Total number of Students who gave examination is 650. The total number of students who failed=( Total number of students who write the examination- Total number of students who passed the examination) =650–559=91 . Or, Total number of students who failed is 14% of 650=91.
